EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Extraction System Module at Position(x=-3.5, y=27.5)
Consists of:
• Burner inserter with drop position (x=-3.5, y=28.5)
Use-case: Acts as the source point where items are extracted for further processing.

### Copper Cable Factory at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
Consists of:
• Cable factory input chest at Position(x=2.5, y=17.5)
• New factory burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=17.5) using direction RIGHT, which is linked to:
 – An additional factory burner inserter at Position(x=2.5, y=16.5)
 – An assembling machine at Position(x=1.5, y=19.5)
Use-case: Forms the interface for copper cable production.

### Belt Depot Extraction Module at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
Consists of:
• Wooden chest (depot) at Position(x=3.5, y=15.5)
• Dedicated transport belt segment at Position(x=4.5, y=15.5) placed adjacent to the depot chest
• Depot burner inserter at Position(x=3.5, y=14.5) using direction UP (connected to the chest and belt)
Use-case: Serves as an intermediate belt depot for receiving items from the extraction system.

### Electricity Generator at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
Consists of:
• Steam engine (generator) at Position(x=-0.5, y=24.5)
• Boiler at Position(x=-5.5, y=24.0)
• Offshore pump at Position(x=-7.5, y=25.5)
Use-case: Provides electrical power to connected structures.

### Stone Furnace (Iron Plate Smelting) at Position(x=-3.0, y=19.0)
Consists of:
• Stone furnace producing iron-plate (result: 5 iron-plate)
Use-case: Smelts ores into iron plates.

### Stone Furnace (Copper Plate Smelting) at Position(x=-4.0, y=21.0)
Consists of:
• Stone furnace producing copper-plate (result: 6 copper-plate)
Use-case: Smelts ores into copper plates.

### Laboratory (Research Facility) with Electrical ID 7106
Consists of:
• Lab configured with an input of automation-science-pack (17 units)
Use-case: Supports research tasks (currently not receiving power).

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Errors during transport belt connection:
 – Transport belts repeatedly failed to connect because they were targeted directly at a Prototype.SteamEngine.
 – Tip: Always add an inserter that feeds items into the steam engine and use that inserter as the connection target.
  
• Errors when placing entities:
 – Attempts to place a wooden chest at (3.5,15.5) either failed due to the target position being too distant or because the item was not in the inventory.
 – Tip: Move closer to the intended placement position and verify that the required entity exists in the inventory before placing.

• Variable naming errors:
 – A NameError occurred because “target_chest” was undefined (suggesting a misnamed variable).
 – Tip: Ensure that all variable names match their definitions consistently to avoid reference errors.
